intro: Calandrinia leucocephala, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Calandrinia leucocephala is drought-tolerant and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
